description:
Came here for the first time for a going away party for friends, and am writing this review as I sit here now for one reason alone: To the Asian girl bartender, you make arguably one of the best Old Fashioneds I've ever had. Kudos. 

To add to this, don't let the exterior of the building fool you - the inside is very casual and well maintained with a nice outdoor patio. Definitely hope to find my way here again.
author: Marty E.

description:
Virgil's has an outdoor patio area that is super cute complete with string lights and outdoor heaters. It's very chill. Love the vibes out there. 

Sometimes though, when El Rio (bar next door) is having an event, the music is played so loud that you can't really hear your conversations and the vibe is completely thrown off. When El Rio has something going on, just go there and skip Virgil's.
author: Caroline P.

description:
UPDATE: Virgils got in touch, say they've fixed the diet soda. I'll post another update if we visit again. But really happy they looked into it and solved the problem.

While I love this bar, they seriously need to fix the soda machine. My wife is Type 1 diabetic and *cannot* have sugar in her drinks. So while I drink at bars, she orders a Diet Coke. However, every time she orders a Diet Coke at Virgil's her blood sugar spikes afterwards, ruining the evening. We even tested the "Diet" Coke with her glucose tester and it contained the same amount of sugar as a regular can of Coke!

We stress "DIET" in the order. We've replaced drinks and watched them pour. Sugar every time. It's fucked up. My wife doesn't eat anything beforehand, so nothing else is contributing to her blood sugar spikes.

Virgil's needs to fix their shit OR someone is going to get sued! Just sayin'. If you're diabetic, avoid this place.
author: Aqua H.

description: Not so nice to head to a friends birthday at Virgil's and be treated very rudely by one of the bartenders. Sucked.  15 years living in the Mission and I've encountered the occasional surly bartender but this bartender shouldn't be dealing with the public.  She was rude to other friends as well.  If you're thinking of bringing your friends here, try elsewhere.
author: ed c.

description:
When I want a bar with a patio that looks like it is a set from a Tim Burton Film I go here. This is one of my favorite bars in Bernal Heights because it's funky and unpretentious. The cocktails are simple yet creative. I usually choose from their selection of whiskies,neat. When I do grab a cocktail it's usually the awesome Marian and Vivian Brown,a Sazerac with blended scotch.
The bar is dark and cozy. It feels like a speakeasy but allows for an escape within the bar to an out door patio. The patio is perfect for sunny days when you need to unwind with a drink. You can also see through the fence to El Rio which allows for people watching when you're the only one on the patio.
The service is friendly understanding of the signs of someone coming in after a rough day at work(me)and they make great cocktails so tip well!
author: Zardu H.

description: Hands down my favorite bar in the city. Virgil's has a cool neighborhood feel but the music, bartenders and drinks always make it fun, even on a weeknight. I've been going here for about 6 years - the staff is consistently welcoming and the cocktails consistently delicious. I'm moving out of the area, so wanted to make sure I sent a shout out to Virgil's. I'll definitely be back.
author: Jill K.

description: Looking forward to visit looks like an awesome place by the reviews.
author: Aman T.

description:
Although I visit the Mission almost every other weekend, I'm surprised why it took me so long to experience the awesomeness of this place. From the outside, it looks like a tiny run of the mill bar. Virgil's has a patio to die for. It's just the perfect chill spot. I went there with my friends and got a great spot to chill with a couple of beers. 

I have heard great things about their margaritas as well. Guess this gives me a good excuse to come here again . 

Note that like most bars in the Mission, this is CASH only. Definite recommend from me
author: Pranav B.

description: Virgil's is a really cool place.  The coolest thing about Virgil's are the owners.  They allowed the group "Listen for a Change" to host an event there tonight and allow them to invite Melody Cafe to bring Organic Mediterranean Food for the event.  It was success.  Everyone enjoyed Virgil's relaxed atmosphere, Virgil's drinks, and Melody Cafe's delicious Organic Mediterranean food.  Thanks for being such an awesome neighbor and business on Mission Street!
author: Leanna L.

description: This is my favorite bar in the mission so far. Dark ambiance with a great vibe. Laura is an amazing bartender that can mix a fantastic cocktail. Everything was delicious.
author: Charles N.

description:
Virgil's is like your ultimate best friend, ready to have a blast no matter your mood.  Want to have a dance party- Virgil's is ready.  Casual date spot- Virgil's has the pseudo-classy drinks that are still affordable .  Feeling like some alone time and a beer- Virgil's won't judge you.  Overall, there's no reason not to love Virgil's.  From,

-Virgil
author: Virgil L.

description: In December, the National Center for Lesbian Rights hosted our annual Men's Event at Virgil's and it was spectacular!  Tom was a joy to work with and very flexible in helping us make the space fit our needs to host the event for about 75 guests complete with light catering, music and space to showcase our work. We used the entire bar as well as the patio, which was lit up magically for the evening.  Our guests were very impressed with the space and happy to support queer owned businesses who share our vision of LGBTQ justice. If you are thinking of hosting a party or gathering of any kind, I highly recommend calling Tom and Lila at Virgil's!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Strong drinks! CASH ONLY. Cute and big outdoor patio with heaters, and a great vibe going on. Definitely will be back here on chill nights when I don't want to go too deep into the chaos of the city. My friends and I haven't really been out in this area so we were worried the vibe might not be that great (too quiet? Too boring? Too far from everything else?) but it was actually exactly what we were looking for that night and had a chill time outside just sippin and talking. Really enjoyed the divey bar atmosphere - chill and still upbeat - but more spacious and clean and not as packed. Good for casual nights!!
author: Nicole L.

description:
I've hosted two events at Virgil's (as well as attended several birthday parties) and I cannot recommend the staff, space or cocktails highly enough.  The staff is organized, friendly and accommodating and there is no charge for reserving tables inside or outside on the HUGE back patio.  
The vibe inside the bar is warm and welcoming - it's modern but not pretentious, laid back but not a dive, and the real deal jukebox has a solid selection of new and old school favorites. The patio has heat lamps over the tables, which are lifesavers when it's chilly out. When El Rio (next door) is hoppin' you can enjoy their dance music without having to yell into the ears of the people you're talking to. And the cocktails are fantastic - a creative menu with a diverse selection of top shelf liquor without the top shelf prices you'll pay in other parts of the city.

Events aside, it's a great place to chill any night of the week. Even when it gets busy, it never feels overcrowded and you're not going to wait long for a drink.  One of my favorite spots in the city, for sure.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Nothing can beat $2 margarita! And since it's cash only, the drink literally saved my day! 

A few rounds of margarita for a few bucks in a nice patio and with live music next door? Count me in!
author: Yuhuan T.

description: Good place to hang out where it isn't too pretentious.  Good outside area for those rare SF warm evenings.  Just alot of smokers.  And there are heaters and quality lighting design.  The drinks are good.  But definitely one of the highlights is that  Virgil will reserve you a table for you.  Big bene if you are trying to connect with others after work.  Next time we will try the $25 pitcher of Margarita's (many others were doing the pitcher of Mojitos). CASH ONLY!
author: SF G.

description:
Came here with my roommate at ~9pm on a Saturday night and, surprisingly, it wasn't that packed. We managed to snag a couple seats at the bar, but there were also several empty tables near the back. I got a spiced derby, which was basically a bourbon and honey cocktail, and it only cost $8! Way cheaper than any of the bars in the Soma / Fidi area!

Overall, great low-key bar. Virgil's doesn't have amazing decor, pretty garnishes on your drinks, or anything besides the essentials really, but the drinks are good / cheap and the bartenders are attentive. Because it isn't trying to be something it's not (i.e. a fancy cocktail lounge or a divey beer bar), I think Virgil's excels at what it is.
author: Tiffany P.

description: I like this bar. Not so many bullshits going on like the next door.Better than El Rio of course. Nobody impose their political views on you, the people who work at door are not huge assholes , no trans species working at door( half hippo/ half woman) no old Italian nazi with deep fried hair from the north behind the bar .Perfect
author: Maria s.

description:
My roommate and I stopped by last Saturday night because we just felt like we had to get out of the house for a bit. Virgil's is actually only a block away and yet we've never stopped by.

It's a low key neighborhood dive bar, cash only - of course, where you can just sit and chill with some friends. They have pitchers of mojitos and margaritas for just about $25. I've already decided I'll need to go back to see how they compare to others in the mission. We were there around 8 and so it was still early and pretty empty. There's some sitting in the back and a lounge area in the front. But I can image it getting pretty crowded. 

While there's almost music on, you can also pick something out of the jukebox near the front. Overall a really chill place with bartenders who seem down-to-earth.
author: Liza X.

description:
Virgil's is fun, I like the couches inside.
They have great specialty drinks and the staff is really friendly 
A little less crowded than the bar next door, and is great for small groups
author: Jad A.

description: When we walked in it wasn't quite what I had expected by the pics on yelp. The actual inside bar area isn't very big and I wouldn't describe it as modern or trendy but its intimate and dark. I could see this place being the perfect place for a first date night getting drinks, or the first stop for a group of gals or guys to talk and pregame. In fact I feel when I return it will be for one of those two reasons. The drink menu was nothing special but not tacky, I ordered a spicy tequila cocktail and it was great! Best part too was that it was only $9 which is totally unheard of in the city. I think for that reason I had 2 or 3- don't judge me lol. They have a cool outside area which is actually where we spent most of our time. We sat next to some sf hipsters eating burritos and nachos, I Definetly thought to myself next time I'm bringing food in too haha. We drank our drinks and since we were outside I was able to vape and overall I had a great time. Only thing missing were some sick beats, the music choice was old-school indie rock which lets be honest you can only stand to listen to that in a bar for so long and after so many drinks you just wanna shake your ass a bit. We could hear the music at el rio playing next door and we ended up going there next for more drinks and dancing. We actually closed the bar there haha. The two together would make for an awesome night out and they are literally next door to eachother so its an easy 2 for 1 night.
author: alix b.

description:
This is a review that can be accomplished with simplicity.

If you're in The Mission, and you want a cool neighborhood bar with a bit of history in the decor, and you want the bar to have a nice back-patio, this is a good place to try.  As many reviews have noted, it is right next door to El Rio.  Sunday afternoons mean cover charges and throngs of Missionistas next door.  Meanwhile, 'ole Virgil's is still reasonably chill.  As someone who A) Wants a seat at the bar if I walk-in, B) Likes to hear other people I am with speak, and C) Enjoys an out-door beer on a back-patio, this place is a winner.  I have yet to see it super crazy, and I think the service was friendly.  

They also have a ton on events and rotating drink specials, which you can check-out on their FB Page:  https://www.facebook.com/VirgilsSF
author: Adam S.

description: This place is ok. Typical dive bar, but with cocktails.  Got the tamarind drink which was ok. My friend actually had a bug in hers, but she was able to get a new one. Plenty of space on a Sunday night. Interesting decor as well, which were super old furniture my family had back in the 80s.
author: Lisa T.

description: Shared a pitcher of margaritas for $25 with a friend. We each got ~3 standard drinks out of it - an economical good time! Patio outside is great for a warm day, not overly crowded but definitely a fight for seats.
author: Rita C.

description:
I wanted to like this place, but I really didn't.

I reserved a space for a party of 15-20, which was great--so glad they did that. But a combo of factors just made me feel like I should have had the party somewhere else--not all of which were their fault.

1. There was a dance party at the next door bar, the noise was insanely loud (and we weren't warned).
2. The table we reserved was dirty and missing a bench. Both things could easily be fixed, but when I asked the bartender to assist, the response was very cold--even though they did fix it.
3. There were lots of dogs on the patio where we were (10-15), and one kept getting into fights. Though people were really unhappy/scared around the dog, no one made them leave.
4. All of the big tables that night were reserved, and my party was constantly being complained at by other guest for having rented the tables. I don't understand why the clientele would act like this if they know Virgil's rents the space. It was unpleasant. 

On the plus side, the drinks were yummy. And we got a free bottle of wine with our reservation, which added a nice touch. But it wasn't enough to make me feel like I'd made the right choice. 

I think if you just wanted to drink, this would probably be a nice place. But as a venue, unless you rent the whole thing, I don't know if it's the best place.
author: Cori N.

description: I'm a big fan of the chill atmosphere on the heated patio, especially during happy hour where I can get $4 draft beers. Their cocktails are also quite delicious and if you're in the mood to share a pitcher of mojitos, you're in luck!
author: Jane S.

description:
Believe it or not, we had our baby shower at Virgil's. It was perfect. They made it super easy by allowing us to reserve a couple tables outside. It was really beautiful. Great for us bc our apartment is too small
to host all of our friends. We brought some simple snacks and our guests got to order whatever they wanted from the really nice bartenders. They even gave us a couple bottles of champagne! I will definitely think of Virgil's for our events in the future.
author: Lis G.

description:
Virgil's is in my regular bar rotation! 

The owners and staff have always been incredibly kind to me and it's clear that they really care about the community. I've been here for fundraisers, rented out tables for birthday parties, come to bingo nights, and watched games here. And I can't say I've ever had a bad time!!

On a nice weekend I really love grabbing burritos and splitting a pitcher on the patio with friends (you can even hear the music from El Rio!)
author: Brianna L.

description:
I can't rave enough about Virgil's!  My hubs and I  decided to get married in the most intimate, low stress* of ways (beautiful SF city hall) but we couldn't shake the feeling that we also wanted to have an awesome low stress* (sensing a theme?) celebration with all of our friends. 
After brain storming on many locations, we decided on Virgils for a few reasons.
1. Great patio! Lots of space and heaters
2. Cool Vibe. Kinda divey, but with fancy cocktail options 
3. You can bring in food from outside vendors
4. ***most important*** Super warm and welcoming staff (especially towards groups/parties)
Every bartender we met and especially the owner, Tom, made us feel like our business was really valued.  We met with Tom in person and had several email exchanges to discuss logistics and details:  A champagne toast for 100 people, multiple pizza deliveries, decorations, music, a photo booth, a plan B for if it rained on our outdoor patio party (this was a legit concern and we were grateful to the staff for recognizing this and not downplaying it).  Fortunately the weather cooperated, but knowing we would be taken care of either way made the event and the days leading up to it so much easier and worry free.
Short story long:  Virgil's was the perfect venue to make our 100 plus people wedding celebration a fantastic event to remember!
author: Patricia L.

description: I recently had birthday drinks at Virgil's because it's a great bar and you can reserve tables there! If you have anxiety about having enough seating for your huge ;) group of friends on your birthday Virgil's has you covered! Just email them and they will promptly respond with whether they have availability and everything you need to know about reserving a table if they do. That's just an added bonus to a bar that is socially conscious with a great jukebox selection and unpretentious staff!!!
author: Emilie S.

description: I was excited about coming to Virgil's because of all of the hype I read when I was searching for cocktail bars in the Mission. Although I very much enjoyed my drink the Sugar Pie De Santo... Virgil's version of a mojito... I guess the vibe was kind of low. Perhaps it having been a Tuesday night and the fact that it was near closing time contributed to the low energy in the room. Nonetheless our mixologist delivered some delightful drinks with a smile and at an affordable price $8 which was a nice way to end our night. Definitely more of a hipster bar kind of dingy and lackluster... but a cool place to grab a quick drink.
author: Astrid M.

description:
Fun time, great outdoor patio but wound up paying $9 for a lemon drop shot. So kind of meh for a bar in the mission. 
Other than that, fun for groups and smoking outside. 2 bathrooms and full bar- still a fun hang out
author: Martie A.

description: Love coming here and sitting in the back patio. Drinks are reasonably priced and strong.  Great place to hang out with friends and grab drink. Oh, dont forget to bring Cash.
author: Sandeep C.

description:
These guys are doing all the right things.  Down to earth, involved in the community, the drinks are great and there's a patio!  They even brought Nap back for Karaoke.  Stop in and support the cause.  

Taking the neighborhood bar into 2016.
author: James G.

description:
I recently hosted an office event with Virgil's Sea Room and received so many positive feedback from the guests! They're very welcoming and accommodating in closing up their bar for the duration of our private office event and supplied us with enough alcohol to keep everyone happy. 

The bar is very spacious and we particularly enjoyed their back patio. We had guest speakers give a short speech during our event and Virgil staff was good at maintaining the music level so that it wasn't drowning out our speakers. This is our second time hosting our annual event and we always enjoy it. 

Tom, the owner, is also very great to work with. He gave us a great deal in booking fees and the drink fees!

Thank you for giving us such a great experience!
author: Victoria C.

description:
Virgil's made an excellent addition to South Mission/Bernal/LA LENGUA area when it opened next door to El Rio, and I'm happy to report that it is just as charming as ever! 

I pay close attention when a new bar opens up within walking distance of my house, and sadly there have been a few that won't be seeing a second trip (think overpriced, "sceney").

Virgil's is the exact opposite: bartenders are all babes, drinks are great and not insanely priced, and the crowd is cute as heck. As HECK, you hear me?

And that patio on nice days is a 'lil slice of heaven.
author: Dan T.

description: I found this spot in a random article online about bars with patios and I loved it. I reserved outside seating for my wife's birthday and the accommodations were met perfectly even with a free bottle of champagne for my wife. The bartender was amazing. He was very kind, understanding and was there for anything I needed. The outside patio was fantastic. It was a cold night though so my wife was sad at the fact we would have to party inside, but with their outside gas fueled torches the cold weather was quickly forgotten about and everyone had an amazing time. You guys really made her night. Thank you so much.
author: Julian P.

description: Love the beer selection, didn't try the cocktails but they looked good! The beer garden in the back was perfect, a nice surprise. It's heated!
author: Liza S.

description:
Great for events! 

Virgil's recently hosted my office holiday party and provided excellent service at every stage of planning. All of my questions were answered in a timely manner (within 24 hours) and the staff was accommodating as to the food we could bring in, music to play, etc. 

In case you're planning to have Virgil's host, here are some helpful logistics. We had 50 people at our event and could have fit another 30 or so guests comfortably. But more room meant we could have our entire party inside at the bar or outside chatting/taking pictures. There were 2-3 bartenders during the event plus another person watching the front door. The space was kept clean, staff took care of setting up our catered food, keeping the drinks flowing and letting us know well ahead of time when we were reaching our bar tab. I would definitely recommend Virgil's for a casual and fun event space!
author: Sarah H.

description: THE BEST. Outdoor heated patio (where you can smoke!!!!) DELICIOUS cocktails, prompt service, cheap prices, good music-seriously one of the greatest bars in SF/the Bay Area. Cannot go wrong!!!
author: Hannah D.

description:
We wanted to go to El Rio but when we got there, the front door lady wasn't letting anyone in (which was weird) and then there was a cover and y'all know I am too old to be charged a cover to get in anywhere. Too old. 

In our search for an ATM, we stumbled upon Virgil's Sea Room. I don't even think there was a sign on the door. Mysterious. Once we came inside and looked around we realized that this place was preferable to El Rio for several reasons. They had seating, both indoor and outdoor, pitchers of margaritas and lovely dark sea-themed decor. Great people watching! 

Here are a couple of things they should work on: Restroom cleanliness and too much ice in the margarita pitchers.
author: Tara H.

description:
I really love this place. 

For years, I've been frequenting their next door neighbor, El Rio. But, as El Rio gets more and more crowded, and more and more expensive, I'm looking for alternatives in the area. Spotlight on Virgil's, El Rio's cuter younger cousin, who's just a tad bit more sophisticated, and less chaotic on weekends. 

Inside is adorably decorated, and the outside area is awesome. San Francisco bars with an outside area are somewhat hard to come by, especially ones that aren't shoulder to shoulder, so Virgil's is a hidden treasure. 

On Tuesday's, they have $2 margaritas. I have been to many margaritas nights at bars, who instead of making fresh, will just pre-make them and poor (yikes). Virgil's makes each one fresh on Tuesday's (and everyday). I usually just go all out and get a double margarita for $4. However, even on Tuesday's, the margarita pitches are regular priced - $25, serves about 6. So, on Tuesday's, skip the pitcher and get single servings - less expensive, more margarita. 

Will be coming more and more. Just crossing my fingers it doesn't get super popular and loses its adorable flair.
author: Alex G.

description:
A promising name, don't you think? That is, unless you suffer from sea-sickness. But not to worry, the only rocking will be coming from El Rio's dance party next door. Virgil's is a calm oasis, complete with sunny patio, simple cocktails, and the possibilty of reserving a picnic table for your group or bday party. Insider tip: your group reservation comes with a free bottle of bubbly, perhaps as a thank-you for filling the place with happy paying customers. 

We spent a couple hours here for my friend's birthday gathering, and it was delightfully mellow for a Mission(ish) spot. If you're stressing about accommodating a large group that will be coming & going, Virgil's seems to be dreamy to work with. Very hands-off, except for the cocktail makin' & shakin'. 

The drink menu was just my style: a few unpretentious $8 concoctions like the Vicki Marlane (vodka, St Germain, lemon, simple). During happy hour, they're even cheaper. The indoor portion looks like your standard watering hole; the back patio is where you want to be.
author: Nique F.

description:
Came here after dinner on a Monday night.

We were planning to go to El Rio next door, but we saw this place and how empty it was.  Sat in the back on the patio next to the heater. Perfect. 

I thought this place was really cute. Hope to come back soon.
author: Jenna R.

description: This is a great bar!  We found it while walking back from dinner at Old Bus Tavern, and were glad we did!  Good cocktails, prompt and friendly service at the bar, elegant decor, lovely outdoor patio, and busy - but not too packed - on a Saturday night!  (The only drawback - it's cash only.)
author: Barnali D.

description: I was there today & ordered a drink & another drink that wasn't available. So I messaged my friend really quick who was outside to see what she wanted & she wanted the same so while the bartender with long hair was making my drink I asked her to make 2 of the same & she gave me a dirty look & made 2 out of the one drink in the shaker than added ice so it was very watered down. If I'm paying is it that difficult to make one more?! I shouldn't have to be looked down on. I felt very uncomfortable. I know it's busy but don't deserve 2 crappy drinks! I never leave reviews but was very bothered by this, especially the dirty looks!
author: Isabel A.

description: Hidden gem in San Francisco. My friend took me here and I've loved it ever since. Great drinks, love the jukebox, nice bartenders, and ambiance. A little hard to find parking but that's San Francisco. :)
author: Jennifer J.

description: I reserved a table (for free!) on Virgil's patio for my boyfriend's surprise birthday party last night, and it was perfect! They made sure the table had signage showing it was reserved, and the heat lamps made the patio so enjoyable on an otherwise cool San Francisco night in July. The cocktails are on point and the patio is so relaxing and carefree. It just made for a perfect evening. Anyone looking to host a party should definitely think about reserving a table at Virgil's!
author: Nathanial O.

description:
My wifey recently achieved a dream of hers and worked super hard to make it happen. So to celebrate I called tom and asked if we could have a surprise party for her and he agreed even reserving two tables for us. Oscar was an amazing bartender and we ended up having the best time. 
Aside from the aspect of it being a queer safe space, it also has great owners and bartenders. Definitely one of the best local neighborhood bars around.
author: Ryan C.

description: Came here after another fabulous SF Fun Run. After running all over the mission our group was ready for some drinks! All the cocktails here look really great, and they have a ton of drink specials. The patio outside is very large and would be perfect for a warm night. They had a the Giants game playing. The staff was very friendly! Will def be back for the cocktails!
author: Hetal P.

description:
Cool, reasonably-priced bar with a great patio. Also, I LOVE that it's dog friendly.

I was drinking Warren Hellmans, which were great.
author: Megan B.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE

Good-ass cocktails, PATIO w/HEATLAMPS, friendly and sexy staff.

I just had my birthday party here. Tom helped me reserve a table on the patio over email and made the whole thing really simple and then he gave me a bottle of champagne for FREE OKAYYYYYYY. They have a great cocktail menu and lots of stuff off-menu if you just ask. I had a mezcal old fashioned and a fresh grapefruit margarita. My friends and I made it through the entire cocktail menu. So bomb.

The staff was ultra friendly and there were like, all mega babes behind the bar (10 points to Gryffindor). I'll be back next year for my birthday and a whole lot in-between.
author: Laura A.

description:
wow big improvement from the bar before it.  
                 The bar that was here before this place was a zzzzz so I was  a lil hesitant but I saw the 2 dollar margaritas and I had to poke my face in one of those.
      They were great, whoa not sweet but definitely buzz worthy.  
       The bartenders and patrons were cool too, I even got my buzz on and had a jam session in a garage with some of the people there who I didn't even know before.
Everyone here is very friendly , everyone seems to come to the bar with different unique story and it doesn't really get too loud in here.    The music is pretty laid back and chill even the rap and hip hop.  I heard the smoothest jazzed out versions of some biggie songs along with others.   I dig this place, I'll be back many times.  I haven't experienced the sea part of it yet. THey have a great patio, and a pool table .
author: Luke S.

description: I thought I had the corner on the best dives in SF and I surely thought nothing new would sneak past my snotty old SF attitude but blow me down, Virgils is amazing. It even has an outside patio and isn't packed with weiners every. single. night. Go. (Don't go.)
author: Smelly S.

description: I wanted to like this place since it's a neighborhood bar but I just don't enjoy it as much as surrounding places. What really put the nail in the coffin for me though is that their bank machine short changed me $20, yet it was taken from my account. I immediately went to the staff and they took my name and told me to call them back so they could contact the machine vendor. They never returned any of my calls. At one point they subsequently implied that it was either my mistake or I was being dishonest and that it wasn't their issue since it wasn't their machine (despite the fact they host it). Ignoring me until I go away is no way to treat a customer and I would have appreciated a more direct approach from the manager.
author: Austin S.

description: Love this place , the owner and their spouse is super sexy.... So nice, so chill, and relatively affordable for SF , can't wait to go and see this place again. Love love love
author: James C.

description: Ahoy matey! A bunch of nonprofits that I work with held a fundraiser at Virgil's Sea Room a few weeks ago -- The Mighty Mutt Fundraiser. It was a great experience, and I would absolutely rent out the space again. The patio is large and we lucked out with sunny weather. Since the fundraiser was to support dog walking in SF Bay Area recreation areas, lots of people brought their dogs, and the bar staff were completely cool with it. It was easy to work with the owners to rent the space and plan the event, and everyone had a blast. Plus the margaritas are really good!
author: Andrea B.

description:
Great - 1. place (location location location - next to el rio and a bunch of good eats and spots) 2. Bartenders (always friendly and cool for any chat) 
3. Drinks (menu always have something yummy and super affordable
4. Vibe - music always chill patio always cozy and w heatlamps
5. Crowd is cool and almost everytime I go I find the most friendly peeps - regulars and newbies ... Bartenders there set a good Tone 
Etc -I'm missin so many things but I hold this place in the highest of regards
author: Antonio H.

description:
Strong drinks, really good patio and not too crowded. It's right next to el rio, but you don't have to pay 10 dollars to hear the band. There is a huge patio, plenty of seating, and you can smoke out here. 

I definitely recommend coming here when there is a band playing next door for a free show! 

It's good stuff. I am definitely coming back for more drinks and a nice relaxing night on the patio.
author: Amy A.

description: First off, the decor is totally cool and homey. The drinks are unusual, creative and yummy and if it's nice the patio is the place to be! I always end up having delightful conversations with perfect strangers! Plus it's the place to get your happy on
author: erin o.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to go. I use to live down the street and I would go meet up with friends or take dates here. I still do even though I just moved out of the city temporarily.

The dude who worked Saturday night, 11/29/14 and Sunday night 11/30/14 is awesome, I really wish I caught his name so I could let the higher ups know about his awesomeness. He was super friendly treated my date and I like old friends, it was my first time seeing him their. I was totally distracted with my date and left my credit card Saturday night. I called Sunday shortly before opening and he said he had my card. I was super grateful and rolled through a few hours later to pick it up.

I really enjoy this place and it has now become my favorite go to bar in the city.
author: Michael B.

description: Went there on NYE and had the nastiest margarita... Never again... My friends and I left within 20 minutes.
author: Dave M.

description:
Look, I loved Nap's. I loved that it wasn't "cute", or wood-paneled, or taxidermied to (literal) death all just to please the bourgeois young gods of our city. 

But my favorite part of Virgil's is how gracefully its owners play homage to everything that came before it - including Nap's iconic karaoke night, w Nap himself still at the helm. And how Virgil's effortlessly charts a righteous sea-faring path into our beautiful City's future via great affordable drinks and an infinitely welcoming atmosphere.

One of the more charming aspects of "Nap's III" is that they've created cocktails named after a number of San Francisco's fearless freaks, faeries, and charitable financiers. My favorite (as a matter of literal taste) is the Warren Hellman, a refreshing variation on the Kentucky Mule, named after that billionaire who continues to fund Hardly Strictly Bluegrass, even after his recent demise. There's also a cocktail after one of my favorite SF icons Frank Chiu aka the 12 Galaxies guy who is holding the Laughing Squid-sponsored sign of conspiracy theory "gibberish" at pretty much every SF street fair. Another is named after Vicki "the liquid spine" Marlane, who was a legendary trans performer at another of my favorite SF haunts, Aunt Charlie's.

I also love that it's become a hot-bed for political activists. In an era when so many bars throughout SF are becoming so averse to public discourse on matters of true importance, Virgil's welcomes that discourse and stages events for people from all walks of life to engage on tough topics. It's a bar in the truest sense - that is, it's a place to gather, talk, debate, argue, make up, and make out over a neat cocktail or cheap can of beer.

One last thing - Virgil's is perfect for bar-hopping, in perfect walking proximity to Rock Bar, Knockout, Royal Cuckoo, and, of course, it's dear sister bar, El Rio.

Phew, now I'm out of breath! I could really use a Warren Hellman right now...
author: Lee H.

description: Stumbled upon Virgil's Sea Room on my last trip to SF. The drinks were fantastic, the service superb, the environment comfy & cool. I heard it is a queer-owned, small business and I love to support that. I love that I can get a pitcher of margaritas. Their margaritas are my jam!
author: A M.

description: Easily one of my favorite bars in SF. Space, spirits, and bartenders are excellent! Recent experience with booking private party went so well. Emailed about a month ahead and they reserved two-tables on a Saturday night for no charge! Amazing. Looking forward to going back.
author: Catherine C.

description:
I LOVE VIRGIL'S SEA ROOM!  

The bartenders are friendly, sexy, and always come up with the best inventive, yet down to earth cocktails!  In an era where SF has become nothing but Edison bulb adorned cocktail lounges, Virgil's remains a true neighborhood establishment. Decorated with a nod to the den of a retired sea captain, Virgil's feels quant and understated inside, but just beyond the restrooms in the back, Virgil's completely opens up onto one of the most beautiful expansive back decks in SF! Sheltered from the wind, and a fence away from the craziness at El Rio, picnic tables and stationary heaters make this back patio a year round must! Virgil's always keeps things interesting with various events such as drag queen bingo every second and fourth Monday, and karaoke on Thursday nights!

If you choose to order from their short but sweet cocktail list, you'll find classic libations with a twist named after "local celebrities and neighborhood icons."  

Their liquors are all mid to top shelf, cocktails have ingredients you can pronounce, and they don't require a show with flamed orange zests.  Bartenders are always on point with attitude and attire, and are quick to whip up any unique creation you may request!

Try the off-menu Surfbort!
author: Jarr V.

description: Great location and even greater bartenders. If you're looking for a spot to chat the whole night on a heated patio or jam to some juke box tunes inside--this is the place. Chill energy most of the time, but often gets pretty hyphy for holiday parties and special events like Pride. Totally worth checking out--and hit up El Río next door!
author: Sean M.

description: Besides the amazing atmosphere, the drinks are always poured heavy! The bartenders are also super sweet.
author: Mina S.

description: This is the most amazing place to spend an evening. The cocktails are the best in town, the music is always perfect, and the ambiance is cozy and fun. To top that off they have a stellar staff.
author: Chris P.

description:
Every time I've been to Virgil's I'm fully satisfied. Wether it be a casual weeknight after work drink, or one of the best New Years Eve parties in San Francisco. 

Solid drinks, great people, superb patio.
author: Chris D.

description: The staff is delightful, the drinks are delicious, and the the atmosphere is divine. The outdoor patio space allows for quiet conversation even when the bar is packed....which is most nights! I highly recommend stopping in for a drink or two at San Francisco's best bar.
author: Julie W.

description: I love Virgil's Sea Room  it's a nice place to get a drink after work meet friends and enjoy all the handcrafted cocktails the staff is really nice and sweet and they really care about what you have to say this is truly one unique mission neighborhood bar with all the bars in the mission this one stands out the best if you haven't been there yet do yourself a favor and stop by say hi and grab a drink and some great conversation...
author: Richard N.

description:
This is the worst bar that I have ever been to.  I love antique-y wall-paper and dramatic lighting.  I love communal, outdoor seating and heat lamps.  I love specialty cocktails so much, I put it in my yelp profile as a thing that I love.  This bar has all of those, and is abysmal.
With 4 friends, we made our way around the specialty drink menu, and the only one that was tolerable was mine, because it was dominated with simple syrup and St. Germain.  Their fancy grapefruit margarita tasted like a nice Salty Dog from The Graduate, that was then doused in sea water.  The negroni was the only drink with flavor, and it tasted like straight up Campari.  Even the Gin & Tonic, a last, valiant effort to give the bar a chance with a classic, inexpensive, well drink, tasted like a gin and water.
As we held our noses and attempted to finish our $8 cocktails, El Rio was calling.  We answered.
author: Laura S.

description: Never felt compelled to rate a spot until Virgil's. Dopest bar, excellent staff, and legit drinks. Tom is a good man, he'll take care of you. Virgil's patio is one of my most favorite outdoor spots in the city. It's a bit of a trek for me on the west side of town but so worth it every time.
author: Rob C.

description: Virgil's Sea Room is my favorite new bar in the Bernal Heights / Mission area.  I have my Birthday Party here every year.  They will reserve an outdoor table for you (seats about 20) for FREE!  They even throw in a bottle of champagne for you!  You can bring food/cake and lay it all out picnic style!  The outdoor area is super well kept, they have heating lamps all over too for when it gets chilly.  Smokers can feel free to light up and they have provided ashtrays on every table.  The staff rules, each and every one of them kicks ass at making drinks, are super nice and fun to talk to.  The decor is super nice and the bathrooms are always clean and well stocked.  They often host special events/benefits and have bingo nights on the first Wednesdays that is super fun.  The cocktail menu is very unique delicious and affordable.  Beer selection is diverse and runs the range from cheap cans to heavy drafts.   I was a regular at the bar Naps which originally occupied this space and was worried about whoever was taking it over and I couldn't be happier with the results!
author: Charlie S.

description:
Really delicious speciality drinks! The bartender Oscar was so funny and nice. 

No No Bingo on Monday nights are really fun also. Great back patio too. Highly recommended. :)
author: Phil C.

description:
I'm writing this review on behalf of my friend Mona who does not have a Yelp account. However, as I am here with her, I feel qualified to write this as well. 

As you can probably tell, we are a little drunk.

The hot toddy that the bartender made for us is very good. Specifically, it included cloves and a cinnamon stick. This is something that Mona says most bars do not deign to include in this drink which is sometimes inconvenient to prepare during busy periods. 

What we are trying to say is that it was good, and it was nice that they did a good job. Also there is lots of seating on the patio on a Friday night! There are also ample heat lamps! This place is good. Better than El Rio. There, I said it.
author: Veronica B.

description: Really nice bar a short stroll from my casa. Quirky, diverse crowd. Lovely spacious heated back patio adjacent to El Rio's. I want to have a little dinner party back there - saw some folks doing it. My Warren Hellmann was TOO SWEET - cloyingly so - but the cool ambiance made up for it, and I am very sensitive to sugar. ICK.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Nice little place in my old neighborhood. Very friendly bartender who bought me shot of mezcal when she found out my pet bird had died. If you like your micheladas extra thick and spicy, check this place out. Can't wait to try their Old Fashioned made with mezcal sometime :)

Just as I was about to leave, two Marina refugees/Mission colonists or whatever came in. The kind of people who use the term "working class" as a non-ironic pejorative, who "did school back East," and who (unforgivably) did not even know what a michelada was!?! But don't worry, I very much expect these two "Beckies"are the exception rather than the rule in Virgil's.
author: Jim Z.

description:
Okay, my review might be biased because I was already tipsy after dinner when I arrived here... I was expecting a different bar and kept walking back and forth looking for the sign.  I kept wondering, "Was it in this direction from El Rio?  Or was it the other way?"

But it was a nice surprise to find Virgil's in its place.  The interior has been redone, and it's not crowded (yet).  Very friendly bartenders and nice customers.
author: Needles K.

description:
I came here on Pride's Sunday (I guess that's called Pink Sunday in these parts). My lady and I were torn--do we go to Hard French or Queerly Beloved? Neither it turned out: Hard French had a $25 cover which we weren't keen to pay, and Queerly Beloved's line looked like it was about an hour or so long. 

So we, the smart ones, headed into Virgil's, sandwiched between the two parties. Turns out Virgil's had quite the impromptu party going on anyways--plenty of people spilling over from both parties, plus the back patio was basically listening in on El Rio's DJ. 

They had a sandwich board outside that bragged about having great Bloody Marys, and I am here to tell you that they are right to brag. Delicious. Their secret ingredient is a splash of Guinness. Lady friend drank a Warren Hellman all afternoon (a whiskey ginger with a twist). Yum. 

Vibe was nice and chill, and I had a good time chatting with folks. Will be back. 

FYI, fancy drinks range from $7-9, well worth it.
author: Allison S.

description:
This bar just opened up a few months ago, right next to the neighborhood favorite, El Rio. I came in with some friends on a Friday night after leaving the aforementioned El Rio which was going off.

We were pretty excited to see that this place was a lot more chill. They've got an indoor lounge area and a pretty nice back patio with communal tables and heat lamps, which are clutch for the handful of warm nights we get in the city.
author: Madhu P.

description: Went here for the first time last weekend. I've always seen it while going to el rio next door.  It is much more quite. Has the same patio space as el rio. $6 wells. I don't know if that was a special thing for that night or a regular thing.
author: Brendan R.

description:
Best new bar in the mission y'all.  The bartenders are first class, and treat ya real good.  Specialty cocktails all over the place, and they even have mint!  And the patio!   Now that's how a patio should look!  not like a chicken yard filled with dirt like some other mission bars have.
Only thing I think needs improvement is the speakers/monitors in and out on the patio.  Y'all got some good ass DJs up in there, and they deserve some good ass speakers for their jams to be blasted.  Last night on New Year's Eve it sounded like the speakers were going to short circuit and explode.  I'm even willing to drink at Virgil's 3x a week to help pay for a new sound system.
author: Sims K.

description:
Went in last night for a quick drink with a friend. The bartender was great, very accomodating when I ordered a Warren Hellman but less sweet, and got great, immediate service. I like that it's not a dive bar but there's no attitude.

I liked the ambiance - it's a great remodel. I'll definitely be back, especially since it's in my neighborhood. Will have to see what it's like on a Friday/Saturday.
author: Erica S.

description:
We made the mistake of coming here on karaoke night.

Other than that, this bar is a total find. Huge patio in the back with heat lamps. Really laidback atmosphere, perfect for the times when you're feeling something quieter than a wild night out, but a bit more adventurous than staying in with ice cream and pyjamas. I would love to come here again.
author: Hilary S.

description:
I miss Nap's!!!!  

...but the bartenders were nice, the new decor is cool, and I appreciate the local love that went into the cocktail creation (they're named after famous San Francisco characters... including Nap himself!).   The place has that slightly-too-shiny "new bar" feel, but i'm sure it'll dirty itself up in no time.  :-)
author: Jane A.

description: Need a quieter place to talk the night away that isn't the lovely--yet jam-packed--El Rio? Virgil's is the place. Our group of friends walked over here and easily found a table for about 12 or so--while we could hear the hustle and bustle of El Rio next door. Worth checking out for sure!
author: Mel G.

description: Bar & Bartenders are top notch!  Clientele sucks!  You ever been to bar in your neighborhood that has so much promise but doesn't pan out...that's the Virgil!  Sorry the most inane conversation from a couple of a-holes made me leave.  Sorry Virgil, it's not you it's..naw...it is you...Arigato!
author: Michael D.

description:
I was stomping my way back through Bernal Heights after an unscheduled foot tour of the Mission and places south, and I saw this place had a sign outside advertising $5 Micheladas.  At that point, that was exactly what was called for.

The bartender was super nice and on-point, and one cervesa preparada invited another.  I enjoyed the dimly lit atmosphere and did some people-watching before I headed back to the trail.

This place doesn't look like much more than a dive bar on the outside, but inside it's definitely a LGBT hotspot.  I was only there on a quiet Sunday afternoon, but it looked like things were definitely starting to pick up there as I was leaving.

Good service, nice laid-back atmosphere... thumbs up!
author: David S.

description:
Let's just rename this place "El Rio is too packed" eh?

It's Sunday. Salsa Night. And there's no room, so you pop over next door to Virgil's Sea Room. Their cocktails are weak and overly sweet and your bartender is to cool to be anything other than snarky, but sitting out on their patio you're practically at El Rio.

And that, folks, sums up Virgil's Sea Room.

*Obviously they are cash only- welcome to the Mission, where the 90's are alive and well!

There is one painting of a boat- it's a "sea room"!

... Okay, I'm just bitter about the poor service and drink quality.
author: K M.

description:
Virgil's and their staff are incredible!

My non-profit company had our Holiday Party there, and Tom was extremely accommodating and helpful right from the start. The inside of the bar has a wonderful dimly lit atmosphere, but the back patio is what makes the place special. We were able to set up the back patio area and have our company holiday party under the heaters at long community tables on the patio- complete with garden lights strung that made it the coziest, most beautiful place for a party. 

Tom and his team allowed us to bring in a caterer, and even guaranteed that if it rained they would reserve all of the tables inside for our large group. Unlike every other bar and venue I had contacted when planning, Virgil's did not charge our group for use of the space and did not have a purchasing minimum for drinks for our group. They also made their speaker and juke box available to us to pre-load with music.

It was a wonderful experience overall, and now that I've discovered this new spot, I will most definitely be going back. 

Thank you Tom and the Virgil's crew!
author: Lauren F.

description: Great for large group parties or birthdays! The outdoor has tons of seating and a really cool vibe. I highly recommend  the mojito specials- they are amazing. Contact them in advance about your large party- they might hook you up- they did for us! This place is a gem :)
author: Lauren F.

description: This place has a very chill and relaxing atmosphere completely different from places a little further north. Drinks are relatively cheap, between $7-10 CASH ONLY, and they have really attentive bar staff. It can get slow when a rush of people come in, but you won't be left with an empty glass for very long. Good cocktail list with the main types of liquor and an extensive range of bourbons and whiskeys. There's a jukebox that has a surprisingly eclectic range of music. Great place to chill out before or after dinner, or just hang out and catch up with old friends.
author: David L.

description: Delish cocktails, fantastic back deck for when you can't take the hordes at El Rio. Not cheap, not fancy, but a good choice in a pinch on a sunny day! Often could use another bartender, though - waits for a drink can get interminable. But be careful late on a weekend night walking home. Huge crowds of drunks outside Roccapulco next door will openly catcall and be creepy at women after midnight.
author: Brooke B.

description: This place is awesome , and quite a departure visually and quality-wise from my very beloved NAPS that was there before it. I LOVE the decor of this bar, like I'd love to have whomever outfitted it be my interior designer it's beautiful and charming . The specialty drinks are fantastic. A standout was the FRANK CHU , a nod to our beloved 12 Galaxies celebrity. My friends and I got a pitcher of margaritas as well and for the price it was good , although not as great as the non mix based specialty stuff they have on their menu. I do think NAPS had more backyard seating and I'd like to see Virgil's maybe follow suit since that backyard area is so big and special especially on nice summer days and nights. The staff was friendly , and the music selections were fantastic. I will definitely be back here
author: Lauren V.

description: Wish they had a bigger tap selection, but it's otherwise a nice, cozy bar.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I  love this place. Great decor, solid drinks at good prices, amazing patio, consistently great service and all around wonderful atmosphere. I had been going here fairly often before my girlfriend decided to celebrate her birthday here. We made a reservation for a group of about 15 and the process was so easy. All of my questions were answered, and everything turned out perfectly the night of the party. They offer pitchers of mojitos and margaritas and that was the best decision I think I've made in a while! Totally delish and packed a perfect punch.  

Overall, I dig this place as a go-to neighborhood bar for a regular night out, and I would definitely have another special occasion here.
author: Natalia P.

description: Utterly obsessed with this place. Fun, relaxed, all types welcome. Great bartenders. And pups can come in. Bonus.
author: Antonia T.

description: This bar has such personality.  Really a understated sexy room but funky and comfortable.  Sophisticated bar drinks. Nice friendly bartender.  Big outdoor garden patio--right in the center of San Francisco's Mission District.
author: Marianne F.

description: My go to neighborhood BAR. Love that it's a chill bar and not overly packed like El Rio. Went there on a Tuesday, loved their 2 dollar margaritas and Tecates. The back yard is amazing and spacious. love love love their FRANK CHU drink it's one of my favs with actual fresh fruit. Definitely a place to check out.
author: Jennifer R.

description: I'm hesitant to reveal such a hidden gem, but I have to give them credit. This is my new favorite bar! They have terrific cocktails, an amazing back patio, free wifi, and it's dog-friendly inside and out. So they pretty much have everything I'm ever looking for in a bar. I only wish they opened earlier than 4pm!
author: Emily A.

description: Bartender made a seriously delicious old fashioned. That alone is enough to keep me coming back whenever I'm in town to visit friends. Great outdoor space in the back for some fresh air. Thanks for a fun night w/ friends Virgil's Sea Room!
author: shellz w.

description: Virgil's just happens to be my neighborhood bar, hero and back-patio sanctuary all rolled into one.  I called this newer establishment on a Friday to see if I was able to celebrate my day of birth there the very next day.  Not only did they go out of their way to accommodate my group on short notice, but the woman I spoke to gave me her personal phone number and arranged a bartender toopen the bar early for my sorrier.  Their enticing cocktails and babe like back-patio with tables, heaters and ample photography opportunities serve as an intimate retreat from El Rio when you want to lounge and hear the person you are speaking to.
author: Allyson D.

description: Sweet bar. It opened up this weekend. Total overhaul on the inside from the bar it was before. Great people working here. Great drinks. Nice mix on the jukebox.  From what I hear, there will be a back deck opening up in a month or so. That'll make this place unstoppable. Do yourself a favor, have a drink or five at Virgil's.
author: Joe J.

description: When I found out that Virgil's was owned by the owner of the now-closed Lexington, I was very excited. El Rio (next door) has been my go-to bar for years, and now Virgil's has become another favorite. They have fantastic craft cocktails for dive bar prices and their bartenders are friendly and quick to recommend new drinks and beers. The ambience is divey in a stylized, retro sort of way, and of course they have an amazing patio in the back. On weekdays, it is the perfect place to relax and chill with friends, but on weekends, the patio quickly fills up so get there early to snag a table if you have a group!
author: Nicole S.

description: The bar is dark and divey keep walking towards the back there is a large outdoor patio to be found.
author: Keren R.

description: One of my favorite bars in the City. Great bartenders, amazing outdoor patio, and the kind of vibe that's harder and harder to find in the City. I  Virgil's!
author: Kyle S.

description: This is a great new bar! I love the old wallpaper that looks like it's been refreshed a bit. There's a solid list of interesting cocktails, and they're all named after SF luminaries and people of note. I recommend the Frank Chu. The bartenders are pretty cool and chill. There's also a fun selection of music on the jukebox and the bartender and I definitely had a fun time singing 'The Chain' together. Go before it gets crowded!
author: Janette W.

description: A fantastic find! Just moved to the city a year ago, and was happy to discover Virgil's. It has a nice casual dive bar atmosphere and the heated back patio is awesome! This is way out of my neighborhood, but totally worth the trip.
author: Kate C.

description:
Solid bar, went on a Friday night and it is more of an pregame place than where you end your night so definitely got less crowded as the night wore on. The bartenders are really quick and the cocktails are like 7/10 which is pretty awesome given the speed. 

It is pretty loud in the main area and a smoker's heaven in the back patio but I hate cigarette smoke and it was still tolerable out on the patio. 

A decent place that I would be willing to go back to.
author: Ojus P.

description: HOORAY Virgil's!!! Love this place, the bartenders are the bestest!
author: Shoshanna C.

description:
Great place to have a party!

I hosted the SFSU Creative Writing unofficial end-of-the-year party this May at Virgil's and everybody that attended had a wonderful time. Tom, the booking manager, was really easy to work with, and he made the entire reservation process stress free. Jesse and all the bartenders were fun, charismatic, and made delicious cocktails. I had originally booked the large and charming back patio for our party (it comes complete with picnic tables and heaters), but when it started raining Jesse let us move inside and spread out inside the bar. We were even allowed to purchase a number of drink tickets so that our guests could enjoy discounted drinks. Even without the drink tickets their many tasty cocktails were reasonably priced, and they have a nice beer selection too. I would highly recommend Virgil's Sea Room to anyone who wants to host a party at a bar with a warm and welcoming atmosphere, dynamic bartenders, delicious drinks, and a booking manager who is very easy to work with.
author: Austin M.

description: Came here after a long ass hike on a late Sunday afternoon, there was about 7 people in there. It could of been a relaxing atmosphere but the music was annoyingly blasted at full-on decimal with Mariah Carey that felt like a ice pick stabbing you right in your ear drum. I am all for loud music at the proper time and place. All we wanted to do was relax with a well deserved beer in a chill atmosphere at 6pm and be able to have a proper converstation without having to shout at each other, we left after the one beer that we could not wait to finish. Sadly this is my second "meh" experience here and will not be back. Will be going to my regular chill jaunts like Rock Bar and Holy Water for that peaceful Sunday drink.
author: Nico B.

description: Terrible bartenders drag down this new venue that otherwise holds a lot of promise. A nice decor and a great, large outside patio could turn this former neighbourhood bar into a destination. Few bar patrons will travel to a destination marred by poor service and ill-concocted drinks, however. Hopefully the bar staff will mature before the window of opportunity closes and relegates this bar at the location of the former, and forgettable, Naps back to being another doorway on a strip of dive bars.
author: Jon R.

description: Great place, nice welcoming atmosphere, friendly and helpful bartender. Had a few $8 drink specials up on the board, and a giant wall of liquor to back it up. Walking distance from the house too? We will definitely be back.
author: K. C.

description: The back patio is really great and I like the decor inside as well.  I only wish the cocktails were better and not so sweet!
author: Jill C.

description: First off I want to thank the crew for making my "weekend boyfriends" birthday amazing. We mentioned that it was his birthday and they brought out a nice bottle of champagne on the house. I didn't want to spend much money on him since I just met him so it was perfect. It is so refreshing to go into a new bar in San Francisco that doesn't have all the pretentious, bridge and tunnel, and gentrification bullshit associated with this once amazing city. It is OG San Francisco all the way. They make me want to come back time and time again. Their patio is a great spot for people watching and the drinks are amazing! I recommend the spicy michelada. Can't wait to come back.
author: Ricardo C.

description:
Great place. The outdoor patio is SAFE (no trip hazards), and CLEAN, and nice!

inside, the bar is also fantastic ... night retro decor, comfortable seating (a rarity in many bars) and it was neither stuffy or hot (also rare!)

Great drinks, fair prices, friendly bartender woman / owner, and incredibly....both restrooms had soap AND paper towels (also rare!)

Keep up the good work...DO NOT let the bathrooms get skanky or nasty!

Don't increase the cocktail prices, because people love this part of the outer mission for cool bars that don't break the bank account (and will drink lots more if drink prices are maintained at fair prices)

great bar!  congrats on a job well done
author: Ted K.

description:
I was pretty excited to find a relatively quiet place but it was downhill from there. I was on the patio for a friend's birthday and some other patrons brought their very rowdy dogs and let them run free. I'm all for well behaved dogs but these ones were running around, knocking people over and had to be pulled away from the birthday treats more than once. I realize that a bar can't necessarily prevent bad behavior on the part of its patrons but one of the employees came out to the patio at some point and totally ignored the dogs' ruckus play.

In addition to the obnoxious dog situation, the drinks seem to have been poured short. I couldn't feel or taste any alcohol in my drink and I'm generally only a bit north of lightweight. I probably won't come here again of my own choosing.
author: OnlyatBrandei S.

description: The drinks were fine. Reasonably priced for sf. Had to wait a while to get service at the bar on a Saturday, but not unexpected. I was having a great time with friends.  There was a ladder near the restroom that did not go anywhere but it was there. I climbed it. And then I got kicked out of the establishment. There was no sign to not climb the ladder. I think that was unfair, as there was no sign not to climb the ladder. What do you expect people that have been drinking to do when there's a ladder in public space with no "do not climb" warnings? Anyway, I suggest they get rid of the ladder or maybe put a sign up so people won't climb the ladder.
author: Marisa M.

description: This bar is amazing! They have delicious drinks and a huge outside patio. The bartenders are fantastic, especially Gillian! Even when the place is swamped she finds time to make sure everyone is happy and having fun...
author: Ryan S.

description: Was there this Friday with some friends and so much fun! The bartenders were super sweet and the drinks were strong. I'll be back!
author: Jodi B.

description: I loved Naps, but I love Virgils too..its a different kinda love. Been spending more time there lately and it is always a pleasure. From the getgo supafine Jill was nothing but awesome to us, and that has continued to be the way things roll with most of the staff... I truly enjoy seeing them and hangin out together. Great patio, pup friendly, fun, and have never had a bad experience there. An additional bonus bonus is that they always have my specific flavor there for me, nice to feel loved. The feeling is mutual, Virgils : )
author: j m.

description: Love the handcrafted cocktails. Something you would expect to find deep in the heart of the mission or lower Haight, but here in Bernal. Looking forward to many more to come!
author: Peter K.

description: What a surprise! This place is a real step up from the previous tenants.  My wife and I don't make it to bernal heights often but this place is worth the trip!  Great vibe and awesome cocktail menu but what really blew my mind was the staff. Ive had my fair share of rude and obnoxious bartenders in San Francisco, but these guys kept our drinks full and made us feel welcome.  Definitely worth the trip to the southern tip of the city.  Be sure to ask the bartender to make you a surfing dragon slayer,  one of the best off menu drinks in the city!!
author: Victor E.

description: Nice new bar.  I'm always on the lookout for places in the city that are a bit different than the typical SF-style bar.  This one's a good mix of atmosphere and tasty beverages.
author: Josh M.

description: Amazing space. Want it to be my New Bar. But please train your bartenders. My dry martini was sweet. The vodka soda was served with a lemon. The whiskey ginger drink was all syrup. I like the space so much I'm willing to stick to beer and Jameson on the rocks, but this place would truly be a gold mine with solid drinks.
author: leyla a.

description: This place is doing it right! The 1st time we happened upon Virgil's was their opening party, we didn't know about the occasion and we were curious about the crowd at this new place. Despite the outside of the bar looking kind of dark and dated (not in a good way/1less star for this), we went in, received quick and friendly service -the bartender smiled, welcomed us and introduced herself as Jill before taking our order! Seriously impressed with this, as most Mission bars these days seem to lean towards bartenders with attitudes of superiority and you're "lucky" that you have been chosen to order a drink from this ultra being- god forbid order a cocktail on a busy night!- loving the way our 1st visit is going right off! I ordered one of their fancy cocktails, the Viki Marlene which was delicious and generous (love a good sized cocktail!), being a Bay Area native it was lovely to see the cocktail menu honor SF personalities.  I was adored the vintage wallpaper and nicely (not cheesy) done sea/shipping theme, we made our way to the patio which is HUGE (by SF space standards) and HEATED! The place was packed this night so we didn't stay as long as we would have liked, but we were excited about our new find! We have returned several times now (worth the trek out there, as we don't live in the neighborhood) and haven't been let down yet- still always friendly service, delicious cocktails (loving the Warren Hellman!) and very generous pours (yay!). Also great seating options when it's not so busy (comfy leather chairs in back, when you want that sort of thing) and on sunny days the patio makes me love SF even more!
author: M M.

description: Sugar Pie Desanto for me and Marian & Vivian for my beau.  Both great.  Well, I don't like whiskey, but he claims his was great.
author: Liz G.

description: Great neighborhood place!!  So much fun and if you haven't tried the surfing dragon slayer it's an absolute  must (as long as you like bourbon).  Highly recommend!
author: Angela T.

description: Great new neighborhood bar! Jillian's awesome and the cocktails are really good. Still a little unclear on the theme but, you know, San Francisco.
author: Adam A.
